reviews.text: I am European who visited Italy min 50 times before relocating to the US 6 years ago. This is hands down THE best Italian food outside of Italy i ever had. I LOVE everything about this place. The authentic food, the outstanding delicious in store baked bread, the home made Limoncello to the "Service included". The this my new favorite restaurant. Trust me, you have to try this.

Servers were in training, so service was a little slow but was alright. Wine service was interesting; both serving staff and manager seemed to lack a lot of basic wine knowledge. For a restaurant with a higher priced wine list that was surprising, and though they were very willing to work with us, it was like we were teaching them about wine. The pizza was good, though some of them were not as flavorful as expected; however it may have been due to us being there towards the end of the night. The appetizer we order was the best part of the meal! We would come back and try it again sometime.

2 Amy's must be the best place to get wood oven pizza around DMV area. Year after year they've maintained the quality and taste and consistency. Their pizzas are to die for, crust is amazing and I recommend getting the meatballs it's small and you can share with one or two people. Order yourself draft Peroni beer and enjoy the best pizza in town!
Delicious! Pizza is a bit too burnt for my taste, but that’s neapolitan style. Favourite thing was the porchetta — skin is crackling to perfection!
Wonderful food and quaint atmosphere! We had the cod croquettes, lamb skewers, deviled eggs and pizza, so so good, we will return soon.

I've been here twice now and neither times disappointed.  They wee fairly busy on Sunday when we got here, so service was a bit lax. Food is phenomenal.  I had buffalo wings and sweet potato fries. The Buffalo sauce was a bit on the light side, so I'd recommend asking for some on the side. Also had the Cuban coffee which was amazing. Definitely will be coming back when in D.c.

The place is very nice and pleasant, outside seating area seems a better option since inside there is no AC and only fans so it is noticeably hotter. I loved that they had oat and almond milk to substitute whole/skim for cappuccino. The hash brown is nicely cooked - crunchy and in a square. If they were to have booths inside the place I would give it a 5 star. But amazing as they have a bar inside too. Prices aren’t as expensive as other restaurants that I visited nearby. The waitress was extremely nice and talkative to us.(:

Open City is one third of a Greek-owned Diner trilogy. All three spots are solid for good food at a fair price. Very Casual.  Full Bar. No set vibe -You will see all types of people as a situations when you walk in. Always friendly service!

Coffee and Tea options have a gravity all their own within the Menu; the selection is as interesting as it is diverse. I strongly recommend the Dirty Chai (I ordered mine with a shot of Vodka- why not!?).

I have yet to encounter a menu item that is even remotely unpalatable. I will say Breakfast is their strong suit, especially for Dinner!  :)

Such great service from Mark 2 mornings in a row! The first day I got the steel cut oatmeal and the second day I got the stuffed French toast with a cappuccino. So delicious! My friend got the open city royale, which she loved. Meals are $10-15 on average.

I was attending a conference down the street and needed lunch before it started. I was seated at table for 1 outside under the tent. The food was great but the waiters were so overwhelmed it gave me anxiety. I almost didn't order something because they were panting from running around. I think they were short staffed or maybe the crowd was larger than expected? Either way, they did their best but it wasn't the best dining experience for me.

Food was WONDERFUL! Only reason for the 4 stars is the service was extremely slow. Make sure you get the hot n juicy sauce for your meal. We got baby and it was plenty spicy. It’s the best! Fried brownies were ok. Would be wonderful with ice cream!

Although the food is great. The service isn’t. My wife and I had to wait over 20 minutes to just be seated while these 3 tables sat dirty and not cleaned. We could’ve been sitting there the entire time if they took the time to bus the tables for us instead of making us wait for no good reason. We had to pull an employee aside to ask if they could clean the table for us to sit down at. We traveled an hour just for the food, so at least we could be seated in a timely manner.

I love going to hot and juicy because the food is really good. I was there on 8/02/22.  I was sat all the way to the back corner table where the bathroom was located. I didn’t really mined because like I said the food is always good here.   I sat there for 10 minutes and I still didn’t get any service. One of the server finally got to me and I told him that I was ready as soon dropped the menus. I ordered 1 pound of shrimp , 1 pound of crawfish with rice and 1/2 of sausage and a lime beer. My food finally arrived but it was missing the sausage. I was trying to get the server’s attention but he never came back. I saw  him and the other servers going to others table and asking them if they need anything but never circled back to me. I finally finish eating my food and still no sign of any servers until a tall white guy/shift supervisor asked me “how was everything here”,  I replied by telling him that nothing was good because no one came and asked if I needed refill on my water and or my beer. I had also told him that I could have easily walked out and they wouldn’t have notice. He’s excuse was that they were transitioning to dinner and different servers. THAT Should never be an excuse!!!
From now on, I will only order food Togo.

Ehhh, I don’t know lol! I live in Louisiana so try to avoid these types of places in other states. When we arrived, there weren’t many guests and it took a long time for us to be seated. In my opinion, the prices for the boiled seafood were outrageous (based on how much the others paid). I played it safe and ordered a shrimp poboy. The shrimp were really small and the sauce on it was weird. They should have just kept it simple and it would have been “okay.” One thing that turned me off was that there were gnats flying around the restaurant. Overall, I know good seafood and this isn’t it. I cannot recommend this place!

I came here with 3 friends for our first time trying crawfish. The food was delicious and the portion sizing was respectable.

The staff is very kind and friendly. They remembered our names throughout the 2 hours we were there, which added a loving feeling.

The seafood bags come with a variety of seasoning and spice options - even if you can’t handle a lot of spice, you can still have a well seasoned meal.

Overall, I recommend this place and my friends and I plan to come back sometime after the holidays :)

For a Tex Mex cantina, it’s decent. Not all dishes are good; the tortilla soup was watery and tasted like a canned soup, and my brisket tacos were too soggy.
We also had the nachos which were somewhat successful and the charred beans and rice were tasty.
The real drawback for me is the fact that they don’t use fresh lime juice in their margaritas. Big turnoff. This is the kind of place that should offer real margaritas and not the fake stuff.

Food had so much flavor. The sauces were so much stronger than I expected and for me that was a good thing. Staff was extremely kind and helpful. Love the ambience in the restaurant and it’s spacious.

Came to the area after visiting the Washington National Cathedral. I am from Florida and found the food and flavors to be average. Service was fine. Prices are right for the area. Lots of people and cool atmosphere.

I'm from Texas and I can say they have very good Mexican food, but the service is lacking, even though they were not very busy. We arrived early afternoon and it took a while to get drinks served and take the order. Then, when the order came out there were only three meals for the four of us. We waited while they cooked the other order and brought it out. We had a good time and especially enjoyed the soft beef tacos, but we did a lot of waiting. They should have made the fourth meal they forgot complementary, but all they did was say they were sorry it took so long.
Food was great, place is HUGE, and sitting outside was very nice. Staff was friendly and the price was slightly on the high side, but the food was worth the money.

name: Spices Asian Restaurant And Sushi Bar
vicinity: 3333 Connecticut Avenue Northwest STE A, Washington

reviews.text:
Spices is a great local Asian restaurant located a half block from the Cleveland Park Metro.  As a vegetarian that have great tofu options including tofu fries with delicious spices and my favorite, Bali Tofu (pictured).  It is seared and has a delicious peanut based sauce.   Everyone who has eaten here with me and orders anything from noodles, chicken, beef to sushi has always enjoyed the dishes. Can get them spiced to your comfort.

Great spot if you are in the area, fresh and quick turn around time.

So-so at best. The food is really salty and sweet, over seasoned and as a Korean I can surely say this is not authentic Korean or Japanese food. My server didn't even notice we didn't have a QR scan code until we had to ask for a menu. The sushi (cold food) came after my hot plates were already finished (why exactly..?). I lived in the area for about 4 years now and I recently made my first visit; probably will not return because the prices are high and the food is mediocre. Btw what you are seeing in the pic is $20+.

I'm from Texas. This was one restaurant we tried that was really good. I'd definitely consider a safe go to when visiting DC. I found other places to be overly spicy and lacking flavor.  That was not the case at Spices. Yum!

Yes. This food is good. The sushi is very, very satisfying. I got 6 pieces of Nigiri sushi, a spicy salmon handrolled piece, and the vanilla mochi ice cream... and it was all very delicious.

The dishes had beautiful presentation, the fish had a lovely bite and texture, the rice wasn't overly dry like you might find with grocery store sushi, the handrolled piece had a lovely layering to each bite, and it was all just very good. It's a pretty plain opinion from me about this: this place has great sushi.

The mochi ice cream was also treated with respect: in terms of its presentation and my enjoyment of it.

The restaurant itself was fairly open and spacious. There were many small tables, to one of which we were seated. I didn't check the bathrooms, unfortunately, so I can't comment on cleanliness or maintenance. Overall, however, the place seemed well kept and generally well treated.

I really have no complaints, from my perspective on the sushi itself. The server was courteous and checked in from time to time. She accidentally gave us the wrong receipt at the end, but thankfully I checked it before she realized.

This is a simple review. Excellent sushi. You pay per piece, if you want Nigiri, otherwise pay by the roll or entrée. I hope my included pictures help entice you to try this restaurant. I recommend everything pictured, and hope to come back for more in the future.
5/5 stars from me.
Every item we ordered was absolutely delicious.  The presentation was fantastic as well.  Sashimi was great, and my udon was perfect. I'll definitely come back.

We ate a delicious dinner at the Lebanese Taverna after a long day at the zoo. The service was great and everything we tried was perfectly cooked and flavored. We had our 3-year-old with us and she enjoyed coloring on the kids’ menus with the crayons they provided. The bathrooms were bright and clean plus there was an area of sinks for hand washing. There was a nice variety of cocktails and beers including non alcoholic of both. You could eat at tables outside or indoors - our table was along the wall with a comfy bench seat. Bonus: the restaurant is directly across from the Zoo metro stop so after dinner our commute was quick and easy. This was one of our favorite places during our trip to DC and we highly recommend a visit!

Might be delicious to others, but personally I did not like it, this was my first experience with Lebanese food.

Some dishes are served cold (on purpose!) and that was hard to adjust to. I could tell the food had great flavor, but I couldn't get over the temperature

The herbal lemonade was good though!

Ordered a taverna platter with shawarma (lamb) and it was a lovely combination of rice, salad, lamb, and hummus. The free bread is beautiful and light/fluffy. Prices are reasonable and plenty of space indoors and outdoors. We even were able to stay until after closing to just chat.

Very nice Lebanese Restaurant. Lots of Halal options and plenty of Lebanese wines/drinks. I had the Phoenician and my companions both had Shawarma sandwiches. Food and drink quality was 10/10 and service was quick and personal. Will come here again.

Service was fantastic even though it was busy. We never felt rushed. They didn’t have the bottle of wine we ordered so they gave us a better on that was perfect with the meal. The only downside was I had so much fun (and so much to drink) that I didn’t take any photos. Fortunately, they let us take home the wine we didn’t finish. That’s the photo I chose.

This is the beast place! We sat for dinner, the atmosphere is amazing, they have good drinks too. The prices are very good for the portions that you get and it’s delicious. The staff is also very helpful and polite. If you are in the aria I recommend!
Great authentic Irish bar in NW DC. Excellent for New York Giants games. Very friendly bartenders who know everybody almost like family. Enjoyed my beer and a Reuben! Fun to be there.

We arrived around 10:50 pm and were looking for something to eat. We asked for the hot dogs and were so happy with the choice. They were amazing. The service was really good as everyones was very friendly and the atmosphere was so great. Music was also fantastic.

The best watering hole in the area. Great place, knowledgeable owner on sports related material, he knew more about my countries sports than I did! Also the only place the a pint - that's 20 ounces not 16 - a proper British pint.

The best place in Washington D.C. for fried pickles.  If you are a fried pickle aficionado, you know how hard it is to find a restaurant that makes them correctly. Seriously though, the staff is friendly and great. The atmosphere is lovely. The menu is what you expect from an American-Irish pub. If you are in the area, stop in and have a bite.

Nice casual restaurant. The DC place is cozier and nicer than Bethesda one. The atmosphere and outdoor is nice. However it is hard to find parking in the neighborhood so plan for that. The bread is delicious and amazing. Drinks are just fine. The steak sauce is tasty but the steak itself is just piece of meat. Overall is a nice and easy pick restaurant to go to.

This is a very cool and interesting experience. The food is good and plentiful. Couldn't quite finish everything that was put in front of me. The yogurt parfait was insanely delicious! The French toast on the other hand... Not sure, maybe it was just too fancy for me. It also took quite a while to get our food and the music was a little loud. I totally get why this place is popular, but maybe not for me.

AMAZING Experience!! I love the idea of this place! There isn’t really much of a menu, you’ll eat very well made steak and fries and the best sliced mushrooms ever! Desert was outta this world and the waiter was one of the best and just made the night perfect🤍 great for dates and business dinners too

If I could give Medium Rare 6 stars, I would. My wife and I went here for my 40th birthday, we chose it based on reviews and it being a highly rated steakhouse in Washington DC, and based on the price of dinner.  It's kind of nice to only have to decide what to drink and how you want your steak cooked! And then the surprise of getting a second helping! Seriously, everything was delicious and I will definitely come back when I'm in DC again.

My daughter brought me here to celebrate my birthday quite a while ago and it was an amazing experience.  We enjoyed the steak, salad and overall everything was wonderful. The ambience is wonderful and the service was great. For my birthday, they brought out a delicious dessert with a huge but wonderful sparkler on it. Quite impressive. The restaurant was pricey but it was a perfect way to celebrate a special day.  If I'm ever in DC, I would definitely go back.

This local bar has been in service to the community for many years and it survived the COVID era. There are over 15 big screen televisions which can be enjoyed anywhere you sit. Multiple games are playing for our enjoyment. The menu had a wide variety and it is delicious. The drinks are well made. The service is very good and the staff is fun and knowledgeable.

It was a sport bar but seemed diversity friendly (lots of queer and multi racial customers).

The rooftop one with the view of the historic Uptown Theater was amazing. The interior on the first floor was a bit dark though.

But the best part about it for our experience was Rene the bartender. He was super friendly and even offered us extra beer when my partner had a down day and when I was about to leave town. Too bad I didn’t catch him when I came back.

Best of luck to you all!

H

I mean, the service here was kinda eh, and the server clearly wasn’t that fluent in English, which I guess isn’t their fault. But they were just very quiet as well and it was very loud in there. The food I think overall was alright, it was just kind of expensive overall. This place has a ton of tv’s though, so I think it would be a great recommendation for somewhere to watch a sports game at.

Plenty of seating space my favorite spot is on the roof when it's open, great service and decent bar food, average prices on most items, great place to watch sports games as they have many TVs, parking can be a little change specially during rush, for a neighborhood bar or option it is one of the best

Good place to have a beer and a bite to eat. Not much of a sports bar. Half the TV's were off, and I think the cable was down. The people were friendly. This IPA is really good! I've only seen it here.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Definitely recommend!

Such an atmospheric place in a nice lively area close to Metro! The food is great, I had Borscht and then the Chef special Beef Pot Roast&Mashed Potato. Everything was amazing! Honestly, I don’t think I have ever eaten such delicious beef! 😋
It’s my new favorite restaurant in DC!
Will definitely come back soon with friends and family!
BTW, it’s a perfect place for private events as they have a huge space on the second floor.

Phenomenal experience at New Heights. This place is a a true gem. The crab cakes tasted better than ones we had on the Chesapeake Bay. The food was great, but the drinks were even better! Cocktails had unique flavor profiles - definitely go for happy hour, the prices are great. Gunchin and Katya went above and beyond. We will be back.

We had a great time at the restaurant! The service was very personal and the recommendations from the staff were on point! The food was all cooked to perfection but the real hidden gems of the restaurant are the s’mores and a well curated wine list. I can’t wait to go back!

New Heights Restaurant in Washington DC is a place that should not be missed! The food was incredible - I highly recommend ordering the fresh oysters, lamb chops, halibut, and Branzino. Not only does it taste amazing, but the presentation of every dish was also outstanding. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, providing excellent service throughout our experience. There’s a great energized atmosphere without being overly loud. Highly recommended! #five-stars #newheightsrestaurant #washingtondc

My wife and I went for lunch here while we were on vacation and was very impressed with this place I don't write many reviews but I had to give recognition to new heights we started with the tuna poke tacos and where blown away with how tasty it was I also had the steak sandwich with truffle aoli very delicious. Also the cleanliness of the bathrooms and restaurant itself tells you they hold a high standard for quality.
Will definitely be back

❤ THIS PLACE! 🤣

They always make me the ALL salami double meat 6-inch sub with extra spinach. It's not on their menu so appreciate their flexibilty.

Two ladies and a nice gentleman run the place... I think all from Nepal originally. The youngest lady is actually the owner😳. I was impressed with her when I found that out.

Support their business! Honestly my favorite  thing about Cleveland Park... Besides all the lovely ladies walking around💋

I cannot recommend eating at this establishment unless you intend to clear out your entire intestinal tract within a few hours. Both my mother and I were stricken by a horrible case of diarrhea. The kind that makes your sides quake, and leaves you exhausted but thankful your still breathing. My mother is 83, and I fear that the experience has most likely shortened her lifespan significantly.  Now I remember why I haven't stepped foot in a Subway in over 10 years.  Never again.

If I could leave a negative rate I would, this place doesn’t not participate in the acceptance of coupons. I order a meatball sandwich the meatballs were not cooked and I asked for it toasted and the cheese was not melted. I would not recommend this location.
The food is about what you’d expect from any Subway, but the employees here are always so kind so I wanted to give them a shoutout.

I always love this Subway, they allow me to taste my seafood sensation meat (I'm super weird about the taste for my sandwich) but they always oblige! Its intimate with like 2-3 tables but they do have outside seating for those nice breezy cool days!

I ordered four vegetarian meals and the vegetables are fresh, I liked the tofu. But I ordered rice noodles for a friend who is gluten-free. Instead, the thicker noodles came which were definitely not the normal rice hair noodles I have either bought or eaten before .The person on the phone said these are the normal rice noodles so be sure and ask what they look like if you order this dish, and especially if you have an allergy to gluten.

We ordered delivery for lunch as we are with patients all day and literally cannot leave the office suite.  The delivery driver (hired by Mr. Chen's- NOT Toast, as we found out) wanted us to go down to the street level to pick up the food).  We told him we could not, so he said that he would return it to the restaurant.  We said ok, and ordered somewhere else.  They refused to give us a refund, said it was Toast's fault-  we got clarification from Toast that it was an in-house delivery.  Never received our food but due to the customer service, will NEVER order from there againl  We disputed it with our credit card company successfully.

Disappointing to see no outdoor dining set up when the street is closed off to pedestrians and neighboring restaurants have sidewalk seating. I ordered delivery and the food arrived cold, 2+ hrs. later. One of the entrees was wrong, and when I called to ask for a refund or store credit, they yelled at me to call Grubhub and hung up the phone.
The best Chinese food in DC. Always get delivery:  on time, food hot, well packaged. THE BEST!

Probably one of the better Americanized Chinese restaurants I have come across. The food had very good flavor so I am not sure what everyone else is tasting but I intentionally ordered some of my favorites to see how the flavors would be and I was not disappointed.

I have been eyeing this place for a while now. My friend decided to take me for my birthday and everything was delicious. We ordered the lamb shank, chaat papri, saag paneer, lamb vindaloo, garlic naan and mango lassi. All of the meats were fall off the bone. We enjoyed the vindaloo more since the broth was so rich in flavor and cumin. Big tip try to drink the lassi towards the end of the meal as it definitely had a lot of tryptophan and made us sleepy. Flavors here are authentic and prices are reasonable. When we arrived the restaurant was completely packed. If you want great Indian food that won't break the bank this is your spot. I do wish they bring back the Indian brunch.

This cozy restaurant has the most hospitable hosts and delicious dishes to offer! I was pleasantly surprised with the beautiful presentation of the dishes and savoured every single bite of the food ordered. I definitely recommend Samosa Chaat, Bhel Puri and Paapri Chaat to anyone looking to try flavourful Indian food. Will be returning to try the rest of the menu.

A truly outstanding gem! All the food is so unique and flavorful!! Their saag paneer, unlike any other saag paneer I've ever tasted, really puts the saag in saag paneer: it's not dense and creamy like saag from other great Indian restaurants, but rather packed with so much spinach, which gives it a smooth, earthy, comfy texture. The cauliflower pecorino kulcha tastes like little slices of pizza, in a good way 😄 The mint paratha is deliciously flaky with just the right amount of butter, and the house gin & tonic is infused with a subtle variety of spices. Overall amazing vibe, amazing service, and, of course, amazing food! I don't usually eat very much for dinner, but I couldn't help but clear up the plates this time, no regrets. Can't wait to come back and try their other dishes 😋
A must go place for a Indian quick bites to briyanies. We tried chicken biriyani and tastes good. Bit over priced to the give quantity.

What a wonderful expirence, the food was outstanding we order a few appetizers, drinks and main dishes we try to choose what was our favorite and it was just too hard to choose everything was absolutely delicious the flavor were delicate not overly condimented. I can't wait to go back and try more dishes, the staff were friendly, attentive  our waiter was very nice and helpful with Yue menu.

My go to sushi delivery in dc! The rolls are fresh and well packed and it’s a good value. I especially like the shrimp tempura roll and angry dragon roll. The sashimi is good quality too! Highly recommend Umi!

Pro tip: if you’re ordering for more than one person, put their name in the notes of the rolls they’re ordering and Umi will group them together.

I was really craving some good sushi!!! That being said, my favorite is Uni. I called around town and finally found a place that had california uni sea urchin. I ordered 1 Unagi ( Eal ) Nigiri, 2 Uni (Sea Urchin) Nigiri, 2 California Rolls w/ Dbl Tobiko & 1 Avacado Roll. My belief was that I could sit down and have a really nice early dinner with my mother. Incorrect, I couldnt, my bad I guess I shouldve asked, but really It should've been told to me by the hostess when we spoke on the phone. Anyway, I decided to go ahead and do take out. The lady at the door was very kind and explained the whole COVID thing, OK fine you get a pass, that was my thought process. We received our to go order within 15 mins or so. Astetically, everything seemed to be fine. However, as soon as I ate my first peice of Uni I knew immediately that it was spoiled. So was the rest of the Urchin, badly. So spoiled u could smell it upon closer examination. The eal was lackluster but edible. Then I got to my California Rolls. The first two peices were edible, however the third had spoiled artificial crab meat. DO YOU KNOW how long it takes for that protein to spoil.??? A VERY VERY long time.! I wasn't even going to write a review, but I'm sorry I paid something like $70 for sushi I literally shoveled up in my arms and threw in the trash. How absolutely disrespectful and dangerous to serve spoiled UNI to my elderly mother and I. Dishonorable is all that comes to my mind. SMH

Easily one of my favorite sushi/Japanese restaurants in DC.  Near the National Zoo by the Woodley metro this is a true neighborhood gem with great quality with fresh ingredients and they do not hold back on the meat, plus friendly staff.

I’ve been coming to this place since 2014 and each time I dine or carry out food they do not disappoint.
Ordered 3 rolls (spicy salmon, spicy tuna, and volcano) - all were terrible. All appeared to contain only imitation crab - no real fish in any. Huge disappointment.

First night visiting DC, we came to Umi.  Overall, it was a good experience.  The service was not exceptional, but not bad, either.  Our appetizers were delicious, and the entrees were fairly good.
I had chicken fried rice, which was good but needed some special sauce (I stole my mother's) and had a few too many onions for my taste.  My dad had sashimi, and he liked most of the fish on it.  My mom had the chicken katsu, which she really enjoyed.  Salads were dressed with a very interesting dressing that started off sweet and ended smoky.  The highlight was definitely the appetizers, though. We had pork gyoza, which was the perfect balance of chewy and crispy.  We also had rock shrimp, which were delightful.  Extremely crispy with a strong umami taste and a touch of heat at the end.  Highly recommend them.

Lillies was not only yummy, but the service was fantastic, even with it being NYE and only having 2 wait staff(that I saw). Everyone really enjoyed their meals: lobster raviolis, chicken Marsala, Tour of Italy, and the lamb! The lamb was some of the best that I have had in a really long time.
If my review was helpful, follow me and you’ll get updates on what I think about the places I visit!

Such a huge fan of Italian food and this did not dissapoint! Love the fact that you could taste how fresh the food was. Also love that it’s a small family owned restaurant but also very intimate setting. Only gave a 4 because when we arrived service was a slow but then we were rushed when the restaurant was closing. Overall great food and good pricing. The tiramisu was also made fresh so I loved it!
Great place, the food was fresh, hot and delicious. It was a great atmosphere. I'll have to try the panda Pancakes next time. The service was really friendly and the drinks were really good.

Exploring DC was especially amazing when our Driver recommended LiLLiES for brunch and it’s location to the Smithsonian Zoo. My boyfriend is in the restaurant industry and enjoyed the creative signature cocktails, service, and the fact that I could order Panda Pancakes!

We had a great event at this location.  we held a program anniversary celebration for approximately 40+ people.  The set up worked well.  The staff was professional, the food was excellent.  Ryan was very easy to deal with and the communication was frequent and easy.  The only draw back and it is the same with many DC venues was parking. Nothing the staff can really do about that so not marking them down for it.  Great place for an event

I ordered a chicken bowl with extra meat and was given LITERALLY 10-15 pieces of chopped chicken (I counted them for her) THE employee was so rude and disrespectful that me and my son declined to purchase the food. This happen to often at Chipotle that I found a spot on Wisconsin Ave N.W named SOL MEXICAN GRILL with great customer service, good quality & quantity food, and better prices. This was my LAST time dealing with this at Chipotle ✌🏾

I love Chipotle but lately every Chipotle I have went to are becoming more expensive and move stingy when it comes to food. The amount of food that is put in the bowls are ridiculous. Before the prices went up they gave you more food and now that the prices have went up the amount of food is terrible that they place in your bowl. I will not buy another bowl or burrito from them. If others stop supporting them as well then maybe they will do right by the customers. I refuse to spend any more money with them just to get a kiddie size meal for that expensive food.

To be honest I got a steak bowl, it was the VERY VERY bottom of the pan, the STEAK was sooo dry I really didn't enjoy it, I had to load it up with sour cream just to get some moisture in it, I normally only use a tiny bit of sour cream...

We had a rice bowl here. It was delicious and filling.

The Mexican chain is situated at a bustling Street of Washington surrounded by multiple restaurants.

Here you can get burritos, wraps , rice and salad bowls.
The costs range from $ 4-10.
Vegetarian and non vegetarian options are available.
Although the food is NOT halal.

It's a self service place and the food is fast moving.
Pick from a variety of meats, types of rice, vegetables, guacamole, toppings and additional suaces.

You can also get a juices and sodas to quench your thirst.

The rice bowls are huge so don't take too much if you can't eat it.

My wife and I had been to the zoo the morning we ate here for lunch and had worked up a pretty good apatite. We wanted to eat lunch before we caught the Metro back to Arlington for a visit there. Wow the portion size at this Chipotle compared to the Chipotle`s back at home in Alabama were way bigger. I got a chicken bowl and my wife got a chicken quesadilla and my bowl was overflowing by the time I got done and all I ordered on it was rice, chicken, queso, and cheese. This by far was the best Chipotle experience that I have ever had.

Delicious bottomless brunch with strong mimosas and fast service. Highly prefer this type of bottomless brunch to the eggier versions around DC. The only negative was the dahi balla tasted stale. Everything else was spot on delicious and well made. Give it a go!

Great dining experience, very pleasant staff.

Food was very good as was the presentation and value.

Speaking of value for money, if you give a restaurant one star in DC because it’s too expensive you may be better of having a Wawa sandwich or cooking at home for yourself… grocery stores offer affordable, abundant selections of fresh and tasty component ingredients for you to make anything you want, let the YouTube or tick tok be your cookbook.

I will return, very nice restaurant 4/4stars.

DO NOT GO!!!!
This my second time coming here- right- why did I go again if it was bad the first time? Cause I LOVE me some Indian food, but the first time I came it was TERRIBLE service and small portions for large prices. Second time, (now) taking it to go I thought it would be different- no TERRIBLE service. Look- I tried to warn you- service is bad, food is okay, and prices are high.

Guys, let me just say something. This is the tastiest Indian food I have ever had in my entire life. It is the best quality you will find, which is why it’s very expensive. Yes, maybe the service isn’t perfect but the food that they serve is quite literally sent from god. I don’t get Indian food anywhere else because it’s all very bad compared to the food that this amazing restaurant makes. My favorite dishes are the chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, butter chicken, with garlic naan. The chicken is cooked to perfection. They do not serve small portions, the bowls that they use look small but believe me, it’s very hard for me to finish even one of them as the food is so filling. I am an extremely tough critic, and seeing that this place has a 4.1 made me upset. If we are judging solely on food it deserves a 5/5 and I say this with complete sincerity. Good job Heritage India. Thank you for making one of my favorite foods of all time. Best, -M

I’m shocked that anyone has reviewed this restaurant less than five stars! My husband and I have gotten regular takeout here for years but finally dined in tonight and the food was even better (we didn’t think that could be possible!) in person.

Portions are very reasonable, we are always stuffed sharing an entree, and the owner and staff are always incredibly friendly. The quality of the food is excellent for the price, and their vegetarian options especially are hearty and satisfying.

Overall, highly recommend! We look forward to continuing our regular takeout and dining in more often, too.

Absolutely fantastic happy hour (shhhhh don't tell!) $4-5 boozy drinks and $2 per 2 pieces of nigiri! That fish tastes fresh and sizes were decent. Excellent customer service even tho they were busy. Highly recommend
The food was amazing, we loved the Sushi, soup, Ramen, and Noodles dishes. Would love to visit again. Wholesome food.

Been coming to Tono for a few years now, usually for the Happy Hour Sushi. The price has gone up from $1 to $2 for certain items, but is still quality.  The restaurant, at one point, did have two floors, but since reopening after COVID generally just see the downstairs open.  Very friendly staff and large selection of sushi, noodles, appetizers or main entrees. Great little spot about a half block from the Woodley Park Metro.
Our sushi was fresh and delicious. Staff was super friendly. Went for the $1 nigiri on happy hour which is a great deal so I’ll definitely be back!

Loved it! Me and two friends stopped by this place for their happy hour deal. We definitely weren't disappointed, and honestly it made us want to come back. When you think happy hour sushi, you usually think the leftovers, small portions,  and not fresh. For sure not the case with this lovely place which means their other food is just as great. Can't wait to stop back and try out their ramen!

name: Eddie's Cafe Chinese Cuisine
vicinity: Talpalar Building, 2600 Connecticut Avenue Northwest, Washington

reviews.text:
Solid Chinese food - I had the chicken and vegetables, and it comes with hot sour soup. Not greasy, full of flavor and well worth it. Hot and sour soup is soooo good. I could have a pint of that and be happy.

Food came out in under 5 min - packaged well for take out. Love this place
So good, large portions and so cheap!! They also deliver for only a dollar. Really really awesome. I got the chicken fried rice and hot and sour soup.
It was ok, nothing special about their Chinese food.

I used to get takeout here for years. Food was always half decent, if you know what to get. Then one time I saw the lady at the register take what was left of the soup that she was eating and pour it into another to-go container. She then packaged it into a brown paper bag with the rest of the order and send it off like nothing happened. She tried to hide behind the plastic so I wouldn't see, but that obviously didn't work. Needless to say I haven't been there since, but I wonder how many times I ate someone's leftovers.
Kung pao chicken was pretty tasteless, just sugary. Definitely not ordering this again. Will update my review in future if I try other things.

I had a skinny margarita and it was PHENOMENAL.

For dinner I chose to have a chicken and steak fajitas and I enjoyed the steak more. But everything was exceptional.

The music sets the scene. This was a wonderful place to dine and our server was fantastic!

Excellent food, great service and good selection of drinks. They know what they are doing, and the meals are prepared like they are meant for family. Definitely in my top 10 for foodies in DC. My selection was Enchiladas with Mole and numerous Patron.
Delicious food and Excellent service. The Lomo saltado and the grilled chicken were cooked to perfection.
Wonderful margaritas and tequila shots. Good quality food for the price, interesting decor!

While our server was very friendly, we came in for just some drinks on happy hour after observing a board outside the restaurant advertising 14 dollar Margaritas. I pointed to the sign and said I’ll have one of those and they charged me 24 dollars instead. Completely crazy prices for one drink but it’s just upsetting that they would overcharge me despite me pointing to the sign and asking for the happy hour drink. I would not recommend you go here.
